snippet: At least 25 people were killed and more than 260 injured when the southern city of Kaohsiung, Taiwan’s second largest, was rocked by blasts that sent flames surging into the streets.
abstract: Explosions rip through the city of Kaohsiung,Taiwan, killing 25 people and wounding more than 260; officials say leak of ethylene, propene or butane may have caused the explosions after flowing into sewage lines but say it is too early to pinpoint a specific cause.
lead_paragraph: At least 25 people were killed and more than 260 injured when the southern city of Kaohsiung, Taiwan’s second largest, was rocked by blasts that sent flames surging into the streets.

headline.main: Gas Suspected in Fatal Blasts That Jolted a City in Taiwan
headline.print_headline: Gas Suspected in Fatal Blasts That Jolted a City in Taiwan
